bibl.title: Cleopatra. A Biography. (Women in Antiquity.)
bibl.note: Introduction. - 1. Cleopatra's Ancestry and Background. - 2. The Ptolemaic Heritage and the Involvement with Rome. - 3. Cleopatra's Youth and Education. - 4. Becoming Queen (51-47 B.C.). - 5. Consolidating the Empire (47-40 B.C.). - 6. The Peak Years (40-34 B.C.). - 7. The Operation of the Kingdom. - 8. Scholarship and Culture at the Court of Cleopatra. - 9. Downfall (34-30 B.C.). - Epilogue. - Appendices. Notes Bibliography. Indices.
bibl.seg: ROLLER Duane W., Cleopatra. A Biography. (Women in Antiquity.)
Oxford, Oxford University Press, 2010, 8°, xiv-252 pp., 11 figg., 3 cartes. ISBN 978-0-19-536553-5. £14.99.

Introduction. - 1. Cleopatra's Ancestry and Background. - 2. The Ptolemaic Heritage and the Involvement with Rome. - 3. Cleopatra's Youth and Education. - 4. Becoming Queen (51-47 B.C.). - 5. Consolidating the Empire (47-40 B.C.). - 6. The Peak Years (40-34 B.C.). - 7. The Operation of the Kingdom. - 8. Scholarship and Culture at the Court of Cleopatra. - 9. Downfall (34-30 B.C.). - Epilogue. - Appendices. Notes Bibliography. Indices.
